data.sentence: The word مِنْ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From

data.meanings: swallowing food after chewing, means of subsistence, devoured/consumed, fed/supplied, things to be eaten, eatables
data.sentence: The word لَءَاكِلُونَ comes from the root ا ك ل and is associated with the meanings: swallowing food after chewing, means of subsistence, devoured/consumed, fed/supplied, things to be eaten, eatables

data.meanings: to avert, be a matter of controversy, dispute about, turn aside, thrust (with a spear), be disputed between. shajar alamru bainahun - the affair or case became complicated and confused so as to be a subject of disagreement and difference between them. shajarun/shajaratun - tree, plant having a trunk or stem, stock or origin of a person.
data.sentence: The word شَجَرٍ comes from the root ش ج ر and is associated with the meanings: to avert, be a matter of controversy, dispute about, turn aside, thrust (with a spear), be disputed between. shajar alamru bainahun - the affair or case became complicated and confused so as to be a subject of disagreement and difference between them. shajarun/shajaratun - tree, plant having a trunk or stem, stock or origin of a person.

data.meanings: gobbling, eating it quickly, to swallow, plague/pestilence, any deadly food, food of people of the fire (of Hell), a certain tree in Hell, a certain tree having small leaves stinking and bitter, dust-coloured tree having a pungent odour.
data.sentence: The word زَقُّومٍ comes from the root ز ق م and is associated with the meanings: gobbling, eating it quickly, to swallow, plague/pestilence, any deadly food, food of people of the fire (of Hell), a certain tree in Hell, a certain tree having small leaves stinking and bitter, dust-coloured tree having a pungent odour.
